content.description: Start sitting at the flake and break right to onto The face. Minis and pockets to flint finish at the ledge. Top out over Karmakazi for tick. Move pads out to drop off.
content.location: Last feature on Right of the Bow.

content.description: Climb up onto the ledge right of the dihedral, and through the pocketed face to the ledge.
content.location: Right of the obvious dihedral to the right of the Bow.

content.description: King Line right of The Bow. Sit start on the flake left of the overhang. Break right, and under the face from the start, and stay low. Use the edge of the face (Holds no more that 6” away from edge) and the slats underneath to cross and top out on the right side of the block.
content.location: Far right side of Right Wall, last overhang.

content.description: Start in an undercling low. Traverse right and up to a small pocket on the blank face, then go for the top.
content.location: Farthest right Problem. The dirty slab starts beyond this route.

content.description: Sit-Start matched on a good hole then go up to a left facing pocket and right along a crimpy-undercling flake. Press into a meat hook, reach okay holds to the crack, and top out the crack. Downclimb or bushwack your way back around.
content.location: To the left of the noticeable crack climb Beavis

content.description: Sit start in the dihedral in the shallow/slopey softball-sized hueco. Move up through the dihedral to the crack. Continue up the crack to the top of the block sitting above the crack.
content.location: Obvious dihedral just right of the arete passed the Bow.

content.description: This is the last wall from approach. It starts just past The Bow at the obvious dihedral, and extend until the trail breaks away from the wall at the overhang.
